body.p:
Columbus Ky Jan 31st 1865
to his exelency
Thos E Bramlett
Frankfort
there is a cavelry force to be raised west of the Tennessee river to protect this country
I hav been solisited by a number of the loyal citizens here to rais and organize a company for that purpos pleas send me a recruiting commission for the same as soon as posable

I wrote to T. P. Hays our representative to obtain an forward t to me the commission named a bove but I suppose from what I sh hav sinc learned he is too mutch engrossed with his brandy to attend to any thing I am extreamly sorry sutch is the case

P S the Rebes are roaming over this country at their leisure robing all to who hav any thing to be robed of I think I shal be able to obtain armes an amunition if so I shal arm each recruit as soon as he is sworn in so I hope I shal be able to make this region rather warm for small squad of them

Columbus Ky
Jany. 31' 1865
Tolley S.
Lieut.
To The Gov --
Desires authority to raise a Co. of Cavalry for protection of the country west of the Tennessee --

on authy
L B. No 10 -- 1865 P 480
Recd A. G. O. Ky 6 Feby 1865
